list_definition.definition: a domesticated animal with long ears related to the horse but smaller.

list_ex_of_english: At all the towns mentioned there were large herds of cattle, numerous goats, and not a few donkeys.
Moreover, the intricacies of herding camels, horses, donkeys, cattle, sheep and goats are simply alluded to in passing, without being investigated.
My experience of the armed forces is that all the donkeys have now left.
Incorporation and denaturing in this respect are doing no more than what we have done for donkeys' years.
I see no justification for introducing legislation to prohibit the import of donkeys.
With the exception of the air base which is fenced off, the donkeys are free to graze on the island.
The donkeys were introduced to their experimental routine 19 days before the start of the trial.
When placed at the back of the tongue the donkeys were frequently able to recover the boli and eject them from their mouths.
